io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.util

Class PlayerUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.zachohara.bukkit.common.util.PlayerUtil

  • public class PlayerUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    The PlayerUtil class outlines some useful static methods that are relevant to players in the game.
    Author:
    Zach Ohara

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String adminName
      The in-game name of the player that is the acting admin for the server that this library (and its plugins) are running on.
      static java.util.UUID adminUUID
      The UUID of the player that is the acting admin for the server that this library (and its plugins) are running on.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean adminIsOnline()
      Determines if the local admin is online.
      static org.bukkit.entity.Player getAdmin()
      Gets a Player object representing the admin of this server.
      static java.lang.String getAdminName()
      Gets the in-game display name of the admin of this server, regardless of whether the admin is currently online.
      static boolean playerIsAdmin(org.bukkit.entity.Player other)
      Determines if a given player is the admin of this server by comparing UUID values.
      static void sendAdmin(java.lang.String message)
      Sends a given message to the admin of this server, if and only if the admin is currently online.
      static void sendAllAdmins(java.lang.String message)
      Sends a given message not only to the admin of the server, but also logs it in the console.

    • Field Detail

      • adminUUID

        public static final java.util.UUID adminUUID
        The UUID of the player that is the acting admin for the server that this library (and its plugins) are running on. If the library ever needs to run on another server, this should be changed to reflect the admin of the new server.

      • adminName

        public static final java.lang.String adminName
        The in-game name of the player that is the acting admin for the server that this library (and its plugins) are running on. If the library ever needs to run on another server, this should be changed to reflect the admin of the new server. Additionally, if the admin ever changes their in-game name, this string should be adjusted to reflect the admin's new name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerUtil

        public PlayerUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • playerIsAdmin

        public static boolean playerIsAdmin(org.bukkit.entity.Player other)
        Determines if a given player is the admin of this server by comparing UUID values.
        Parameters:
        other - the player to compare to the admin.
        Returns:
        true if the given player is the local admin; false otherwise.

      • adminIsOnline

        public static boolean adminIsOnline()
        Determines if the local admin is online.
        Returns:
        true if the admin is currently online; false otherwise;

      • getAdmin

        public static org.bukkit.entity.Player getAdmin()
        Gets a Player object representing the admin of this server. null is returned if the admin is currently offline.
        Returns:
        the admin of this server.

      • getAdminName

        public static java.lang.String getAdminName()
        Gets the in-game display name of the admin of this server, regardless of whether the admin is currently online.
        Returns:
        the name of the admin.

      • sendAdmin

        public static void sendAdmin(java.lang.String message)
        Sends a given message to the admin of this server, if and only if the admin is currently online.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be sent to the admin.

      • sendAllAdmins

        public static void sendAllAdmins(java.lang.String message)
        Sends a given message not only to the admin of the server, but also logs it in the console.
        Parameters:
        message - the message that should be sent.
